channel.title: Exion Client Model Loading
channel.description:
I've been trying to get my client to load models for a while now, and I finally came across a possible answer, to uncomment [code]//preloadModels[/code] in my client's client.java
Well, I did that but when I tried to run my client after compiling, I got this:
[img]http://i51.tinypic.com/2z6bbrp.png[/img]
any help is greatly appreciated

item.title: Exion Client Model Loading
item.dc:creator: @_Java6 `Java
item.description:
@_Java6 wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:12, topic:415393”][quote author=`Java link=topic=517349.msg3757699#msg3757699 date=1316620918]

Are you using a refactored client? If so make sure you have the Raw folder in your cache.

Not sure what that means, I’m using Exion client though.

I already had a Raw folder, but it was in the main section with sign, cache, sprites, etc. Moved it inside of the cache folder.

Same error :
[/quote]So your client is Renamed. My process I gave you is for Non-Renamed.[/quote]

ah, I suppose you don’t have one for a renamed client?

Here’s my current preloadmodels void if it helps

[code]public void preloadModels() {
File file = new File("./Raw/");

File[] fileArray = file.listFiles();
for(int y = 0; y < fileArray.length; y++) {

String s = fileArray[y].getName();
		byte[] buffer = ReadFile

("./Raw/"+s);
Model.method460(buffer,Integer.parseInt

(getFileNameWithoutExtension(s)));
}
}

private void saveMidi(boolean

flag, byte abyte0[])
{
signlink.midifade [/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Exion Client Model Loading
item.dc:creator: @_Java6 `Java
item.description:
@_Java6 wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

preloadModels(); is basically saying grab the void, which the () means void, on client startup.

Gotcha, so I replaced my preload models void with that and still got the error, though… What could be the problem?

This gets so frustrating sometimes :\

Read full topic

item.title: Exion Client Model Loading
item.dc:creator: @_Java6 `Java
item.description:
@_Java6 wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:6, topic:415393”]Try public void preloadModels() { File file = new File(signlink.findcachedir() + "Raw/"); File[] fileArray = file.listFiles(); for (int y = 0; y < fileArray.length; y++) { String s = fileArray[y].getName(); byte[] buffer = ReadFile(signlink.findcachedir() + "Raw/" + s); Model.method460(buffer, Integer .parseInt(getFileNameWithoutExtension(s))); } }[/quote]

Replace my preloadmodels void with that? Because the preloadmodels that I uncommented was the next one, not the void

[code]preloadModels();
if(!

lowMem)
{
nextSong = 0;

try
{
nextSong =

Integer.parseInt(getParameter(“music”));
}

catch(Exception _ex) { }
songChanging = true;

onDemandFetcher.method558(2, nextSong);
while

(onDemandFetcher.getNodeCount() > 0)
{

processOnDemandQueue();
try
{

				Thread.sleep(100L);
				}


			catch(Exception _ex) { }

if(onDemandFetcher.anInt1349 > 3)
{

	loadError();
					return;
			

}
			}
		}
	[/code]

EDIT: Tried it anyways, still got error

Read full topic

item.title: Exion Client Model Loading
item.dc:creator: @_Java6 `Java
item.description:
@_Java6 wrote:

Yeah, Exion is PI.

Sorry, being a little more specific… My problem is apparently in my loading text?

[code]StreamLoader streamLoader_6 = streamLoaderForName(5,

“update list”, “versionlist”, expectedCRCs[5], 60);
drawLoadingText(60,

“KaelenScape is Loading!”);
onDemandFetcher = new OnDemandFetcher();

onDemandFetcher.start(streamLoader_6, this);
		Class36.method528

(onDemandFetcher.getAnimCount());
Model.method459

(onDemandFetcher.getVersionCount(0), onDemandFetcher);

ModelDecompressor.loadModels();
preloadModels();
[/code]
Seems kind of coincidental that the error occurs just before the preloadmodels method I just uncommented…

Read full topic
